body:
### Problem

Undercurl works when terminfo is in `~/.terminfo/x/xterm-256color` but not when using identical system terminfo from `/usr/share/terminfo/x/xterm-256color` (default). When not with a terminfo file in the `~` directory, the undercurls in neovim will show as simple underlines.

**Additional context:**
- WSL environment
- Both terminfo files are byte-for-byte identical
- Issue is nvim-specific, not terminal-specific
- Shell is `zsh`
- Undercurls work in terminal in any case, but not in nvim
- Setting `export TERM="tmux-256color"` also fixes the no undercurl in neovim problem (We're not running in a tmux session here, it works for zsh)

I'm pretty sure it was working fine 2 days ago and suddenly stopped without me being able to remeber having done anything (no nvim update, no setting $TERM, no terminal settings change...)

### Steps to reproduce



1. Have identical terminfo in both locations (verified with `diff`)
<details>
<summary>The file I've used:</summary>

Obtained with `infocmp $TERM > xterm-256color.terminfo`

2. Remove `~/.terminfo/x/xterm-256color` - undercurl breaks in nvim
3. Restore `~/.terminfo/x/xterm-256color` - undercurl works again

### Expected behavior

Should work with system default `usr/share` terminfo ?

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.12.0-dev-656+g462f7aaa8e Build type: RelWithDebInfo LuaJIT 2.1.1744317938 
**as well as**
NVIM v0.11.2 Build type: RelWithDebInfo LuaJIT 2.1.1748459687

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

did not test

### Operating system/version

WSL version: 2.5.9.0 Kernel version: 6.6.87.2-1 WSLg version: 1.0.66 MSRDC version: 1.2.6074 Direct3D version: 1.611.1-81528511 DXCore version: 10.0.26100.1-240331-1435.ge-release Windows version: 10.0.26100.4351

### Terminal name/version

wezterm 20250510-092908-4a210168

### $TERM environment variable

xterm256-color

### Installation

AUR

You can see terminal debugging info when the 'verbose' level is >=3 (see `:help 'verbose')`.  Try this:

    nvim -V3log
    :q

Then the file named `log` will have a `--- Terminal info ---` section. Please post that section.

(Note: invoke `:q` manually, so that the builtin UI has a chance to start up. Don't add `-c "q"` in the command-line args.)

No idea if this is relevant but just to be clear, there are no mention of Smulx in the decompiled output:
```
â¯ infocmp $TERM | grep -i "smu"
        smm=\E[?1034h, smso=\E[7m, smul=\E[4m, tbc=\E[3g,
```


***

EDIT: Well now I messed up and deleted my backup while testing this and so I recompiled as I thought I initially did (with `infocmp xterm-256color > file.ti` and `tic file.ti`)... but I've now got this diff output from a working `~/.terminfo/x/xterm256-color` file vs my current (non undercurl) one:
```
275,276d274
<   memory_lock               meml       = ^[l
<   memory_unlock             memu       = ^[m
278d275
<   Smulx                     = ^[[4:%p1%dm
293d289
<   ext.set_underline_color   = ^[[58:2::%p1%d:%p2%d:%p3%dm
```

Note again that even tho the Smulx capability isn't present here, in the terminal colored undercurls work.

> Note again that even tho the Smulx capability isn't present here, in the terminal colored undercurls work.

But apps like nvim can't know that without either (1) getting a hint from terminfo, or (2) doing feature-detection.

The fact that something works in your terminal isn't related to terminfo.

If it works when you add the entry to terminfo, then it sounds like the "system vs user" thing might have been a mistake?

If wezterm has a feature-detect query that we should be using, we can consider that. Otherwise, it sounds like there is no action for us to take here.

> The fact that something works in your terminal isn't related to terminfo.

Ok

> If it works when you add the entry to terminfo, then it sounds like the "system vs user" thing might have been a mistake?

No I'm unable to add anything by editing terminfo then compiling it that would produce any changes if that's what being asked. Using a system vs user terminfo file still provides pretty different output in the nvim log, as indicated in my first code block. Even with  the loss of undercurls in now both cases.

Unfortunately since I've lost my "working copy" (again, it had an indentical decompiled output when diffed) of xterm256-color so I'm in a bit of a crutch as for further exploration of a working "user" location vs a faulty "system" one...

Right now all I can say is that for me using a standard-issued xterm256-color file (from a ncurses reinstall) on Arch in WSL on Wezterm just doesn't provide undercurls capabilities inside NeoVim ... 

"It used to, then it used to when inside the user `.terminfo` location, and now it just doesn't anymore" is honestly all I can really say with current understanding ... if you have any pointers.

[wezterm's docs](https://wezterm.org/config/lua/config/term.html) show how to build a wezterm-specific terminfo file.

```
tempfile=$(mktemp) \
  && curl -o $tempfile https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wezterm/wezterm/main/termwiz/data/wezterm.terminfo \
  && tic -x -o ~/.terminfo $tempfile \
  && rm $tempfile
```

It also says: 


> You can then set `term = "wezterm"` in your `.wezterm.lua` config file.
>
> Doing this will inform some software of newer, more advanced features such as colored underlines, styled underlines (eg: undercurl)

It also has notes about WSL.

Yes and it does provide undercurl support, though this doesnt solve the mystery of what happened in my experience with the previously working support for `xterm-256color` TERM variable, it seems at least like a better fix that using the tmux variable.
We don't have the resources to investigate mysteries here.
I will definitely steal that quote

title: Undercurl not working with system terminfo but works with user terminfo on WSL (xterm-256color)
